column4: network manager of gnome shell is always overrites /etc/resolv.conf file and use the old dns. :(
you can set interfaces to dhcp (address only) in network manager and manually define DNS servers
i try it. the same think. there is no another possiblity to change the dns excepti gui of newtork manager?
you can use other apps or purely use interfaces and resolv.conf. I advise this on desktop systems on wired connection
